title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Samuel chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Samuel Chapter 17.

questions.question: Who advised Absalom to choose twelve thousand men to pursue David at night?
options: Ahithophel
Hushai
Jonathan
Amasa
questions.correctAnswer: Ahithophel
questions.explanation: Ahithophel gave this counsel to Absalom as recorded in 2 Samuel 17:1.

questions.question: What was Ahithophel's plan for attacking David according to 2 Samuel 17?
options: Attack when David is weary and strike the king only
Gather all Israel and fight in person
Lay siege to a city
Send spies to watch David
questions.correctAnswer: Attack when David is weary and strike the king only
questions.explanation: Ahithophel planned to attack when David was weary and smite only the king, causing the people to flee (2 Samuel 17:2).

questions.question: What was Absalom's reaction to Ahithophel's counsel?
options: He was pleased with it
He rejected it completely
He was indifferent
He decided to wait for another opinion
questions.correctAnswer: He was pleased with it
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:4 states that the saying pleased Absalom and the elders of Israel.

questions.question: Who did Absalom summon to hear his counsel after Ahithophel?
options: Hushai the Archite
Jonathan
Zadok
Abiathar
questions.correctAnswer: Hushai the Archite
questions.explanation: Absalom called for Hushai the Archite to hear his counsel as mentioned in 2 Samuel 17:5.

questions.question: What was Hushai's opinion about Ahithophel's counsel?
options: It was not good at this time
It was the best plan
It should be delayed
It was inspired by God
questions.correctAnswer: It was not good at this time
questions.explanation: Hushai told Absalom that Ahithophel's counsel was not good at this time (2 Samuel 17:7).

questions.question: According to Hushai, how is David described in his warlike nature?
options: A man of war who will not lodge with the people
A peaceful man who avoids battle
A weak leader
A man who flees from danger
questions.correctAnswer: A man of war who will not lodge with the people
questions.explanation: Hushai described David as a man of war who will not lodge with the people (2 Samuel 17:8).

questions.question: What did Hushai advise Absalom to do instead of following Ahithophel's counsel?
options: Gather all Israel from Dan to Beersheba and go to battle himself
Send spies to follow David
Wait for David to attack first
Build fortifications
questions.correctAnswer: Gather all Israel from Dan to Beersheba and go to battle himself
questions.explanation: Hushai's counsel was to gather all Israel and go to battle in person (2 Samuel 17:11).

questions.question: True or False: Absalom and all the men of Israel thought Hushai's counsel was better than Ahithophel's counsel.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:14 states that Absalom and all Israel said the counsel of Hushai was better than the counsel of Ahithophel.

questions.question: Who did Hushai instruct to send a message to David to warn him?
options: Zadok and Abiathar
Ahithophel and Joab
Jonathan and Ahimaaz
Amasa and Joab
questions.correctAnswer: Zadok and Abiathar
questions.explanation: Hushai told Zadok and Abiathar the priests to send a message to David (2 Samuel 17:15-16).

questions.question: True or False: Jonathan and Ahimaaz were able to enter the city openly to deliver the message to David.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: They stayed by Enrogel because they could not be seen entering the city (2 Samuel 17:17).

questions.question: How did the woman help hide Jonathan and Ahimaaz from Absalom's servants?
options: She covered the well's mouth with a covering and spread ground corn on it
She hid them in a secret room
She disguised them as merchants
She sent them away on a horse
questions.correctAnswer: She covered the well's mouth with a covering and spread ground corn on it
questions.explanation: The woman spread a covering over the well's mouth and ground corn so it would not be known (2 Samuel 17:19).

questions.question: What was the outcome after David received the warning about Ahithophel's counsel?
options: David and all his people passed over Jordan without loss
David was captured
David fought Ahithophel's army and lost
David stayed in the wilderness and waited
questions.correctAnswer: David and all his people passed over Jordan without loss
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:22 says David arose and passed over Jordan, and none were lost.

questions.question: What did Ahithophel do when his counsel was not followed?
options: He went home and hanged himself
He joined David
He fled to another country
He confronted Absalom
questions.correctAnswer: He went home and hanged himself
questions.explanation: Ahithophel saddled his ass, went home, put his house in order, and hanged himself (2 Samuel 17:23).

questions.question: Who did Absalom appoint as captain of the host instead of Joab?
options: Amasa
Jonathan
Ahimaaz
Hushai
questions.correctAnswer: Amasa
questions.explanation: Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab (2 Samuel 17:25).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Then David came to ________.'
options: Mahanaim
Jerusalem
Gilead
Rabbah
questions.correctAnswer: Mahanaim
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:24 states that David came to Mahanaim.

questions.question: True or False: Shobi, Machir, and Barzillai brought food and supplies to David and his people in the wilderness.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: They brought various foods and supplies because the people were hungry and weary (2 Samuel 17:27-29).

medium.title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Samuel Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with anxiety about being overwhelmed by enemies or challenges. Based on 2 Samuel 17, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in times of danger?
options: Trust that God can turn even good counsel to defeat for His purposes
Rely only on human wisdom to escape trouble
Avoid all conflict by hiding permanently
Act impulsively without seeking advice
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God can turn even good counsel to defeat for His purposes
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:14 shows that God appointed to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel to bring evil upon Absalom, teaching us that God's sovereignty over adverse situations can bring about His purposes even through human plans. Verses 1-4 and 23 demonstrate the contrast between human plans and God's will.

questions.question: How does 2 Samuel 17 teach us about the importance of seeking godly counsel before making decisions?
options: Consult multiple perspectives and weigh their wisdom
Make decisions quickly without advice
Follow the first advice given always
Ignore counsel from others
questions.correctAnswer: Consult multiple perspectives and weigh their wisdom
questions.explanation: Absalom listens to both Ahithophel and Hushai (2 Samuel 17:5-6), showing the value of hearing different viewpoints. The chapter reveals the consequences of following ungodly counsel versus wise counsel (verses 7-14).

questions.question: Which of the following best illustrates humility and contentment as shown in 2 Samuel 17 when facing adversity?
options: David receiving provisions from friends despite being in exile
Absalom boasting about his army's strength
Ahithophel acting independently without consulting God
Hushai refusing to help David
questions.correctAnswer: David receiving provisions from friends despite being in exile
questions.explanation: Verses 27-29 show David accepting help from Shobi, Machir, and Barzillai who provide food and supplies, demonstrating humility and contentment during hardship.

questions.question: When faced with opposition, what does 2 Samuel 17 teach about perseverance and faithfulness?
options: David and his men faithfully follow the warning and move quickly
David ignores the warning and stays put
David abandons his people
David fights without strategy
questions.correctAnswer: David and his men faithfully follow the warning and move quickly
questions.explanation: In verses 21-22, David acts on the intelligence received and crosses the Jordan with all his people, showing obedience and perseverance through trials.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to rely on their own strength rather than God's help in a difficult situation. How does 2 Samuel 17 illustrate the danger of this attitude?
options: Ahithophel’s counsel was good but rejected by God for Absalom’s downfall
David trusted in his army alone and was victorious
Hushai advised Absalom to avoid all battle
Absalom prayed for God’s help before fighting
questions.correctAnswer: Ahithophel’s counsel was good but rejected by God for Absalom’s downfall
questions.explanation: Ahithophel’s counsel (verses 1-4) was wise, but God overruled it (verse 14), showing reliance on human plans without God’s blessing leads to defeat.

questions.question: How does 2 Samuel 17 emphasize the role of strategic prayer and intercession in spiritual battles?
options: Hushai secretly advising David’s supporters to warn him
Absalom praying publicly for victory
David confronting Absalom without counsel
Ahithophel making sacrifices for success
questions.correctAnswer: Hushai secretly advising David’s supporters to warn him
questions.explanation: Hushai sends a message through priests Zadok and Abiathar to warn David (verses 15-16), illustrating strategic intercession and communication in spiritual conflicts.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Samuel 17, David’s trust in God is seen in his willingness to flee when warned of danger.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David heeds the warning and moves quickly to safety (verses 21-22), showing prudent trust in God’s guidance and protection.

questions.question: True or False: Absalom immediately rejected Ahithophel’s counsel without hearing anyone else’s advice according to 2 Samuel 17.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Absalom first listened to Ahithophel and then called Hushai to hear his advice before making a decision (verses 5-6).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hushai counseled Absalom to gather all Israel from Dan to ________, as the sand by the sea for multitude.
options: Beersheba
Jerusalem
Hebron
Gilead
questions.correctAnswer: Beersheba
questions.explanation: Hushai advised Absalom to gather Israel from Dan to Beersheba (verse 11), emphasizing the vastness of the army needed for battle.

questions.question: How does 2 Samuel 17 demonstrate the importance of integrity and honesty in communication during crises?
options: Jonathan and Ahimaaz faithfully relay the true counsel to David
Absalom’s servants lie about the whereabouts of the spies
Hushai withholds information from David
Ahithophel deceives David’s men
questions.correctAnswer: Jonathan and Ahimaaz faithfully relay the true counsel to David
questions.explanation: Verses 17-21 recount Jonathan and Ahimaaz risking danger to truthfully inform David about Ahithophel’s counsel, showing integrity in communication.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is shown by the woman who helped hide Jonathan and Ahimaaz from Absalom’s servants in 2 Samuel 17?
options: Courage and faithfulness
Selfishness and fear
Rebellion and pride
Indifference
questions.correctAnswer: Courage and faithfulness
questions.explanation: The woman courageously covers the well’s mouth and deceives Absalom’s servants to protect the messengers (verses 18-20), exemplifying faithfulness and bravery.

questions.question: Based on 2 Samuel 17, how can we learn about humility in leadership from David’s example?
options: David accepts help and provision from others willingly
David demands all supplies be brought to him
David refuses aid from others
David ignores the needs of his people
questions.correctAnswer: David accepts help and provision from others willingly
questions.explanation: In verses 27-29, David receives generous gifts from friends, showing humility and dependence on God’s provision through others.

questions.question: What does 2 Samuel 17 teach us about the importance of being vigilant and discerning in spiritual warfare?
options: David’s men use intelligence and warning to avoid ambush
David ignores warnings and is caught unaware
Absalom’s men are cautious and victorious
Ahithophel’s advice is immediately accepted
questions.correctAnswer: David’s men use intelligence and warning to avoid ambush
questions.explanation: Verses 15-22 show how God’s people use discernment and timely warnings to evade danger and survive, highlighting spiritual vigilance.

questions.question: How does 2 Samuel 17 illustrate the biblical principle of stewardship and generosity within the community of believers?
options: Friends provide food and necessities to David and his people in the wilderness
David hoards all supplies for himself
The people steal from others to survive
Absalom refuses to share with his army
questions.correctAnswer: Friends provide food and necessities to David and his people in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Verses 27-29 describe Shobi, Machir, and Barzillai supplying David’s group with food and provisions, exemplifying generosity and good stewardship.

questions.question: What does the suicide of Ahithophel in 2 Samuel 17 teach about the consequences of despair and rejecting God’s purposes?
options: Despair leads to tragic endings when one rejects God’s will
Suicide is praised as a solution
Ahithophel was rewarded for his counsel
Ahithophel fled to fight another day
questions.correctAnswer: Despair leads to tragic endings when one rejects God’s will
questions.explanation: Verse 23 records Ahithophel’s suicide after his counsel was rejected, illustrating the danger of despair and not trusting God’s sovereign plan.

questions.question: According to 2 Samuel 17, how does faithfulness to God and His people during trials impact the outcome?
options: David’s faithfulness leads to the safe crossing of Jordan with all his people
Absalom’s army defeats David immediately
David abandons his followers
God abandons David for fleeing
questions.correctAnswer: David’s faithfulness leads to the safe crossing of Jordan with all his people
questions.explanation: Verses 22 and 24 show David and his people safely crossing the Jordan, demonstrating that faithfulness to God’s guidance preserves His people.

hard.title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Samuel Chapter 17.

questions.question: What was Ahithophel's initial military strategy against David as advised to Absalom?
options: To pursue David immediately with 12,000 men and strike the king only
To gather all Israel from Dan to Beersheba before attacking
To besiege David in a city with ropes and drag it into the river
To wait for David to become weary and then negotiate peace
questions.correctAnswer: To pursue David immediately with 12,000 men and strike the king only
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Samuel 17:1-3 shows Ahithophel advising Absalom to choose 12,000 men to pursue David at night, strike the king only, and cause the people to flee.

questions.question: How does Hushai's counsel contrast with Ahithophel's in terms of military approach?
options: Hushai advised gathering all Israel and attacking in person, while Ahithophel recommended a swift targeted strike
Hushai suggested a peaceful negotiation, while Ahithophel wanted immediate battle
Hushai advised retreat and hiding, while Ahithophel wanted to attack immediately
Both advised the same strategy but differed in troop numbers
questions.correctAnswer: Hushai advised gathering all Israel and attacking in person, while Ahithophel recommended a swift targeted strike
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Samuel 17:7-13 show Hushai recommending a large-scale, personal engagement by Absalom, contrasting Ahithophel’s swift night attack plan.

questions.question: What metaphor does Hushai use to describe David and his men’s mindset?
options: A bear robbed of her whelps
A lion stalking its prey
A mighty oak in a storm
A flock of sheep without a shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: A bear robbed of her whelps
questions.explanation: In 2 Samuel 17:8, Hushai compares David and his men to a bear robbed of her whelps, emphasizing their fierce and desperate nature.

questions.question: Which tactic did Hushai suggest if David sought refuge in a city?
options: To bring ropes and draw the city into the river until it was destroyed
To lay siege and starve the city
To negotiate a surrender with the city elders
To burn the city from the outside
questions.correctAnswer: To bring ropes and draw the city into the river until it was destroyed
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Samuel 17:13 explains Hushai’s counsel to bring ropes to the city and drag it into the river, showing a total destruction plan.

questions.question: Why was Hushai's counsel accepted over Ahithophel's according to the text?
options: Because the LORD had appointed to defeat Ahithophel's good counsel
Because Hushai was more popular with Absalom
Because Ahithophel was suspected of treason
Because Ahithophel's plan was too risky
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD had appointed to defeat Ahithophel's good counsel
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:14 states explicitly that the LORD appointed to defeat Ahithophel's counsel to bring evil upon Absalom.

questions.question: What was Hushai’s secret mission after giving counsel to Absalom?
options: To send urgent warning to David to avoid the wilderness plains
To assassinate Ahithophel
To gather more troops for Absalom
To negotiate peace with David
questions.correctAnswer: To send urgent warning to David to avoid the wilderness plains
questions.explanation: In 2 Samuel 17:15-16, Hushai instructs Zadok and Abiathar to quickly warn David to not lodge in the wilderness plains.

questions.question: How did Jonathan and Ahimaaz deliver the warning to David without being detected?
options: They hid in a well covered with a spread of corn and a covering
They disguised themselves as merchants
They crossed the Jordan River at night
They traveled openly but avoided the city
questions.correctAnswer: They hid in a well covered with a spread of corn and a covering
questions.explanation: Verses 2 Samuel 17:18-19 describe how they hid in a well covered by a woman with corn spread over the mouth to avoid detection.

questions.question: What was the outcome after David received the warning and acted on it?
options: David and all his people crossed the Jordan safely by morning
David was captured by Absalom’s forces
David fought a battle and lost many men
David fled to a foreign land
questions.correctAnswer: David and all his people crossed the Jordan safely by morning
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:22 recounts that David and all his people passed over the Jordan and none were missing by morning.

questions.question: What was Ahithophel’s response when his counsel was not followed?
options: He returned home, prepared his household, and hanged himself
He sought to counsel Absalom again
He fled to a neighboring kingdom
He conspired with Joab against Absalom
questions.correctAnswer: He returned home, prepared his household, and hanged himself
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Samuel 17:23 describes Ahithophel’s despair leading to his suicide after his advice was rejected.

questions.question: Who was made captain of Absalom's army in place of Joab?
options: Amasa, son of Ithra, an Israelite who married Abigail
Zadok, the priest
Ahithophel
Jonathan, son of Abiathar
questions.correctAnswer: Amasa, son of Ithra, an Israelite who married Abigail
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:25 states Absalom made Amasa captain instead of Joab, noting Amasa’s family connections.

questions.question: Where did Absalom and Israel camp after crossing the Jordan?
options: In the land of Gilead
Mahanaim
Jerusalem
Bethlehem
questions.correctAnswer: In the land of Gilead
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Samuel 17:26 records Israel and Absalom pitching their camp in the land of Gilead.

questions.question: Which theme in 2 Samuel 17 is foreshadowed by the opposing counsels of Ahithophel and Hushai?
options: Divine sovereignty over human plans and the eventual downfall of Absalom
The futility of war and the need for peace
The importance of family loyalty over political ambition
The superiority of wisdom over military might
questions.correctAnswer: Divine sovereignty over human plans and the eventual downfall of Absalom
questions.explanation: The text in 2 Samuel 17:14 highlights that the LORD appointed to defeat Ahithophel's counsel to bring evil upon Absalom, emphasizing divine sovereignty.

questions.question: The Hebrew word translated as 'mighty men' in this chapter primarily denotes what kind of warriors?
options: Experienced and valiant soldiers skilled in war
Levites trained for temple service
Mercenaries hired from foreign nations
Untrained militia
questions.correctAnswer: Experienced and valiant soldiers skilled in war
questions.explanation: In 2 Samuel 17:8 and 17:10, 'mighty men' (Hebrew: gibborim) refer to valiant warriors of great experience and courage.

questions.question: True or False: Absalom and all the elders of Israel immediately rejected Ahithophel’s counsel.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Samuel 17:4 shows that Ahithophel’s advice pleased Absalom and the elders, but later Hushai’s counsel was preferred.

questions.question: What cultural practice is illustrated by Ahithophel being buried in the sepulchre of his father?
options: Respect for ancestral family tombs reflecting lineage and honor
Immediate cremation upon death to prevent defilement
Burial outside the city to avoid ritual impurity
Public display of the body for mourning
questions.correctAnswer: Respect for ancestral family tombs reflecting lineage and honor
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Samuel 17:23 indicates Ahithophel was buried in his father’s sepulchre, a common Hebrew practice honoring family heritage.

theological.title: 2 Samuel Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Samuel Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was Ahithophel's counsel regarding the pursuit of David?
options: To choose twelve thousand men and pursue David immediately
To gather all Israel and confront David directly
To fortify the city and wait for David to come to them
To send spies to monitor David's movements
questions.correctAnswer: To choose twelve thousand men and pursue David immediately
questions.explanation: Ahithophel advised Absalom to select twelve thousand men to pursue David immediately at night to catch him weary and strike only the king (2 Samuel 17:1-3). This counsel reflects decisive military strategy and the desire to end the conflict swiftly, consistent with God's providence in directing the outcomes of human plans (Proverbs 19:21, Isaiah 10:5-6, Romans 8:28, James 4:13-15).

questions.question: How did Hushai describe David and his men to Absalom?
options: As weary and weak-handed
As mighty men, like a bear robbed of her whelps
As easily frightened and disorganized
As hiding in a city awaiting attack
questions.correctAnswer: As mighty men, like a bear robbed of her whelps
questions.explanation: Hushai portrayed David and his men as fierce and valiant warriors, comparing their anger to a bear robbed of her cubs, and emphasized David’s experience in warfare (2 Samuel 17:8). This imagery communicates the divine empowerment of God's anointed and those who stand with him (Psalm 18:39, Isaiah 41:10, Hebrews 11:34, Ephesians 6:10).

questions.question: What was the main reason Hushai gave for rejecting Ahithophel's counsel?
options: David and his men are mighty and will not be easily overcome
The twelve thousand men were not enough to pursue David
David was hidden in a well and could not be found
The elders of Israel opposed Ahithophel's plan
questions.correctAnswer: David and his men are mighty and will not be easily overcome
questions.explanation: Hushai argued that David’s men were mighty and valiant, and that an immediate attack would fail because David would not lodge with the people but be prepared for battle (2 Samuel 17:7-10). This reflects the biblical principle that God strengthens his servants for the challenges they face (Psalm 144:1-2, Isaiah 40:29-31, 2 Corinthians 12:9, Philippians 4:13).

questions.question: What strategic advice did Hushai offer Absalom instead of Ahithophel's plan?
options: Gather all Israel from Dan to Beersheba and go to battle in person
Send spies to infiltrate David's camp
Build fortifications around their cities
Offer peace negotiations to David
questions.correctAnswer: Gather all Israel from Dan to Beersheba and go to battle in person
questions.explanation: Hushai counseled Absalom to gather the whole army and personally lead the battle against David (2 Samuel 17:11). This counsel misled Absalom but illustrates how human plans can be thwarted by God's sovereign will (Proverbs 16:9, Isaiah 14:27, Romans 9:19-21, James 1:13-15).

questions.question: How did the elders of Israel respond to Hushai's counsel compared to Ahithophel's?
options: They preferred Hushai's counsel over Ahithophel's
They rejected both counsels and sought a third opinion
They followed Ahithophel's counsel only
They were divided and could not decide
questions.correctAnswer: They preferred Hushai's counsel over Ahithophel's
questions.explanation: Absalom and the elders declared that Hushai's counsel was better than Ahithophel's, but this was according to the LORD’s will to frustrate Ahithophel's good counsel (2 Samuel 17:14). This highlights God's providential control over human decisions and the defeat of evil plans (Psalm 33:10-11, Proverbs 21:30, Isaiah 46:9-10, Acts 4:27-28).

questions.question: What role did Zadok and Abiathar play in the events of this chapter?
options: They were priests who relayed Hushai's message to David
They led the army against Absalom
They counseled Absalom to follow Ahithophel's advice
They betrayed David to Absalom
questions.correctAnswer: They were priests who relayed Hushai's message to David
questions.explanation: Hushai communicated with Zadok and Abiathar, priests who helped send a warning to David to avoid danger, demonstrating the role of faithful spiritual leaders protecting God’s anointed (2 Samuel 17:15-16). This is consistent with the biblical role of priests and prophets as intercessors and messengers (Numbers 27:21, 1 Samuel 9:9, Hebrews 7:25, 1 Timothy 2:1-2).

questions.question: What was the content of the message sent to David through Jonathan and Ahimaaz?
options: Do not lodge in the plains of the wilderness; pass quickly
Prepare for battle against Absalom immediately
Return to Jerusalem to reclaim the throne
Hide in the city of Mahanaim
questions.correctAnswer: Do not lodge in the plains of the wilderness; pass quickly
questions.explanation: The message warned David not to stay in the wilderness plains that night but to cross the Jordan quickly to avoid capture, reflecting God's protection over His chosen king (2 Samuel 17:16, 21-22). This echoes God's care for His people in peril (Psalm 91:3-6, Isaiah 43:2, John 10:27-29, Romans 8:38-39).

questions.question: How did Ahithophel respond after his counsel was not followed?
options: He returned home and hanged himself
He joined David's camp
He gave another counsel to Absalom
He fled to another country
questions.correctAnswer: He returned home and hanged himself
questions.explanation: Upon seeing that his advice was rejected, Ahithophel went home, arranged his affairs, and committed suicide (2 Samuel 17:23). This tragic end indicates the seriousness of rejecting wise counsel and the consequences of despair, contrasting with God's sustaining grace (Psalm 34:18, Proverbs 3:5-6, Matthew 11:28-30, 2 Corinthians 1:3-4).

questions.question: Who did Absalom appoint as captain of the host in place of Joab?
options: Amasa
Zadok
Ahithophel
Jonathan
questions.correctAnswer: Amasa
questions.explanation: Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab (2 Samuel 17:25). This change in leadership reflects political maneuvering and human efforts to secure power, often opposed to God's anointed servants (1 Kings 2:5-6, Psalm 75:6-7, Proverbs 16:12, Acts 2:23).

questions.question: Where did Absalom and Israel pitch their camp?
options: In the land of Gilead
In Mahanaim
By the Jordan River
Near Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: In the land of Gilead
questions.explanation: Absalom and all the men of Israel camped in the land of Gilead (2 Samuel 17:26), a region east of the Jordan. This location is significant in biblical history as a place of refuge and conflict (Genesis 31:38, Judges 11:1, 2 Kings 15:29, Ezekiel 27:6).

questions.question: Who provided provisions to David and his men in Mahanaim?
options: Shobi, Machir, and Barzillai
Ahithophel and Zadok
Jonathan and Ahimaaz
Joab and Amasa
questions.correctAnswer: Shobi, Machir, and Barzillai
questions.explanation: Shobi son of Nahash, Machir son of Ammiel, and Barzillai the Gileadite brought food and supplies to David and his people, showing loyalty and support during David's hardship (2 Samuel 17:27-29). This kindness aligns with biblical themes of hospitality and support for God's servants (Ruth 2:14, 1 Kings 17:7-16, Acts 9:36-43, Hebrews 13:2).

questions.question: What was the spiritual significance of God frustrating Ahithophel's counsel?
options: It demonstrates God's sovereignty over human plans
It shows that God supports Absalom
It proves that human wisdom is always superior
It indicates God's abandonment of David
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates God's sovereignty over human plans
questions.explanation: The text explicitly states that the LORD appointed to defeat Ahithophel’s good counsel to bring evil upon Absalom (2 Samuel 17:14). This reveals God's ultimate control over events, ensuring His purposes prevail despite human intentions (Isaiah 46:9-11, Proverbs 19:21, Romans 8:28, Daniel 4:35).

questions.question: What does the comparison of David's men to a bear robbed of her whelps reveal about their nature?
options: They are fiercely protective and angered
They are weak and vulnerable
They are fearful and prone to flee
They are indifferent to Absalom’s threat
questions.correctAnswer: They are fiercely protective and angered
questions.explanation: Hushai’s imagery (2 Samuel 17:8) likens David’s men to a bear robbed of her cubs, emphasizing their intense protective fury and readiness to fight. This portrays the righteous indignation and divine empowerment of God's people (Psalm 35:1-3, Nahum 2:12, Ephesians 6:17-18, 2 Timothy 1:7).

questions.question: What does David’s immediate obedience to the warning about Ahithophel’s counsel signify spiritually?
options: His trust in God’s guidance through human agents
His fear of Absalom’s army
His distrust of his own generals
His desire to avoid confrontation
questions.correctAnswer: His trust in God’s guidance through human agents
questions.explanation: David acted quickly on the message sent by Hushai via the priests, showing his trust in God’s providence working through people (2 Samuel 17:21-22). This exemplifies biblical faith trusting God’s direction (Psalm 37:5, Proverbs 3:5-6, Isaiah 30:21, Hebrews 11:8).

questions.question: What does the presence of priests Zadok and Abiathar with David indicate about God's covenant?
options: God maintains His covenant through faithful priestly support
The priests abandoned Absalom immediately
The priests were neutral in the conflict
The priests sought political power for themselves
questions.correctAnswer: God maintains His covenant through faithful priestly support
questions.explanation: Zadok and Abiathar’s loyalty to David amid civil strife reflects God's ongoing covenant faithfulness and the priesthood's role in upholding God's promises (2 Samuel 17:15-16, Psalm 110:4, Hebrews 7:23-28, Numbers 25:10-13).

questions.question: What theological theme is illustrated by the defeat of Ahithophel's wise counsel?
options: God's providential control over evil plans
The futility of trusting human wisdom
The inevitability of Absalom's success
The absence of divine intervention in politics
questions.correctAnswer: God's providential control over evil plans
questions.explanation: The narrative shows that even the best counsel of an enemy is subject to God's sovereign will, who frustrates evil plans to accomplish His purposes (2 Samuel 17:14). This corresponds with biblical teaching on God’s sovereignty and the ultimate triumph of His kingdom (Job 42:2, Isaiah 14:27, Romans 9:21-23, Revelation 19:11-16).
